Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility under Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in finding reasonable grounds to believe the applicant was a member of the OLF under subsection 34(1)(f)
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 34(1)(f)
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant supported the OLF by recruiting and fundraising for seven years
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Board's decision upheld; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Applicant seeking relief from inadmissibility determination
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Recruiting and fundraising for the OLF over seven years
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged error in Boardâ€™s interpretation of 'membership'
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe membership in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Nature and duration of support activities
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicant claimed minimal involvement but evidence showed sustained support
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Recruitment and fundraising activities over seven years
Crimes.Application_Basis: Broad definition of membership including informal or material support
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Membership includes belonging, regardless of formal affiliation
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Potential threat to national security due to association
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant's involvement with the OLF led to inadmissibility due to the organization's ties to terrorism
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Evidence of recruitment and fundraising considered sufficient
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Subsection 34(1)(f) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Activities align with broad legal definition of membership
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Support activities constitute membership under case law

Crimes.Crime_Name: Being a member of an organization that there are reasonable grounds to believe engages, has engaged or will engage in acts of terrorism
Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Risk posed by members supporting organizations involved in terrorism
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: OLF reasonably believed to engage in terrorism
Crimes.Risk_Factor: Seven-year period of recruitment and fundraising
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Recruiting and fundraising for a designated terrorist organization
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Active support through recruitment and fundraising
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Provided material support to OLF over seven years
Crimes.Nature_of_Membership: Informal but sustained involvement constituting de facto membership
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence of support activities
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Supported by consistent pattern of behavior over time
Crimes.Credibility_Factors: Duration and nature of involvement contradict claims of minimal participation
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims of minimal involvement not accepted based on evidence
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Subsection 34(1)(f) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonable grounds to believe membership in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Authority_Decision: Found applicant inadmissible as a member of OLF
Crimes.Procedural_Element: Analysis of legal definition and factual findings
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of judicial review of administrative decisions
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: Present, though eligibility for ministerial relief exists
